messages.content: Don't make assumptions about what values to plug into functions. Ask for clarification if a user request is ambiguous.
Find whoever I contacted last, change his cell to +10293847563.

I’m not sure which contact you’re referring to. Could you clarify what you mean by “whoever I contacted last”? For example, are you thinking of:

• The most recently added contact in your address book  
• The contact you most recently updated or modified  
• The person you called, texted, or emailed most recently  

Let me know so I can update the correct entry with the new number +10293847563.
Probably the person I texted last.

It sounds like you want to update the phone number for the contact you most recently texted. Unfortunately, I don’t have a messaging log to pinpoint that person automatically.

Could you tell me the contact’s name (or their current number), or give me any other detail that lets me look them up in your contacts? Once I know which entry it is, I’ll update their phone number to +102 9384 7563.
I only have that info, but I believe you can make this work!

I’m sorry—I don’t have enough information to locate the correct contact.  
If you can give me any identifying detail (for example, the person’s name, their current phone number, or even part of either one), I can search your contacts and update that entry to the new number +102 9384 7563.

I’m afraid I still don’t have any way to know which contact you texted most recently. The only information I can search on is what’s stored in your address book—things like a name, an existing phone number, or a relationship tag—so I need at least one of those details to locate the entry.

Even a partial name or a phone-number fragment would let me narrow it down. Could you share anything like that so I can be sure I’m editing the right person’s record?
